text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Morocco hosts seminar on efforts to unify divergent Islamic trends in different countries.
- Two French nationals arrested on drug charges in Tangier.
- U.S. Agency for International Development grants Morocco $4.1 million for developing small businesses.
- Euro-Maghreb gas pipeline might be operational in October.
- Interior Minister Basri asks electors to draw cards to take part in referendum on constitutional reform due on September 13.
